info.headline: Severe Thunderstorm Warning issued May 04 at 11:20PM CDT until May 04 at 11:45PM CDT by NWS Shreveport
info.description: ...A SEVERE THUNDERSTORM WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 1145 PM CDT FOR SOUTHWESTERN MCCURTAIN...NORTHWESTERN BOWIE AND RED RIVER COUNTIES... At 1120 PM CDT, severe thunderstorms were located along a line extending from 9 miles northeast of Manchester to 7 miles northeast of Clarksville to 9 miles east of Bogata, moving east at 45 mph. HAZARD...60 mph wind gusts. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Expect damage to roofs, siding, and trees. Locations impacted include... Clarksville, Boxelder, Idabel, Avery, Annona, Haworth, Garvin, Farmers Hill, Beaverdams, Lydia, Negley, Harris, Cuthand, Silver City, English, Albion and Bryarly. HAIL THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX HAIL SIZE...<.75 IN WIND THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX WIND GUST...60 MPH
info.instruction: For your protection move to an interior room on the lowest floor of a building. Continuous cloud to ground lightning is occurring with these storms. Move indoors immediately. Lightning is one of nature`s leading killers. Remember, if you can hear thunder, you are close enough to be struck by lightning.
